page.description: Set the value of a control in the Dialog.

argument.name: honorChangeEvent
argument.description: Default = T. Causes the onChange event for the control to fire when the value is set.

section.title: Discussion
section.description: If the field you want to set is in a Repeating Section, use 'name:rownumber' for the field name, otherwise the row with focus will be updated. By default honorChangeEvent is true. This causes the onChange event for the control to fire when the value is set.
section.note: IMPORTANT: Unlike standard Javascript techniques to set the value of a control, the .setValue() method sets the control's state in the Dialog Object to be dirty (in the same way that the control becomes dirty if the user types a value into the control). Checkbox and Multi-value Dropdownbox Controls - See the example for information on how to set the value of a multi-valued control (e.g. Checkbox or multi-line Dropdownbox).
